Replace.Text: Well done! We stand as kin!
I cannot put Gallic lives in your hands.
Join hands with me, and together our people will crush our rivals!
Welcome to my camp! I promise that there is no one hiding in the closet with a sword. At this time.
I understand. You must be careful.
Peace is stifling. Only in war can we see who is the greater chief.
I have bested many enemies in war before, and finally I shall match my strength against yours!
I personally led your delegation on a hunt! They were adequate.
No, I will not open my gates for your men, regardless of how many gifts they bring.
Our envoys carry with them salted hams, wild game, and barrels and barrels of wine! Come, let us feast!
All the Gauls spit at the sound of your name, at your dark deeds, at your many crimes. I shall tell all the world that you are our mortal enemy!
You think deceit and cowardice are virtues, but I, Ambiorix, see you for what you are. In time, so shall the rest of the world! (Denounces You)
All you see is the land of the Gauls, and I am Ambiorix, their chief.
Will you come to my city? We have opened a cask of wine that is, I promise, entirely safe to drink and not at all poisoned.
Yes.
Come, I will tell you about the cities of Gaul, if you tell me about those of your lands.
Well met.
So many troops! Ha ha! Look at them all!
Your lands are quiet and peaceful. And weak.
Let us sign a binding agreement where no one can betray each other. I'm serious this time.
Yes, let us lay down our arms. You have nothing to fear from Gaul. Promise!
Weakling! We will run your forces off the land!
I grow bored of the battlefield. Let us rest for now.
Your people are welcome to walk through Gaul.
The safety of Gaul is in its walls, and its borders. No.
My troops wish to pass through. We promise that the Gaesatae will put pants on.
Your troops lurk nearby with weapons in hand. Send them away before I send them away.
The Gauls roam where they please.
Gaul means you no harmâ€¦ today. We will retreat.
Such power! Perhaps I underestimated you before. Now, in defeat, I will give you the respect you are due.
I won't fall for your petty tricks.
For now, we accept.
Our people stand as one! Well, mine stand just a bit higher, but you see what I mean.
You are not yet worthy enough to call yourself a friend to the Empire.
Come! Be a friend with the glory of Rome! Be a friend to God!
You have chosen the side of Rome, and God, and me.
Friends? With you? No.
I shall tell my historians to record your empire for the future, after I have ground your cities into the dust.
You deserve nothing less than war, but in my abundant mercy, I will make it brief and decisive.
Your delegation was shown the wonders of the Empire. I hope they can resign themselves to returning to your lands.
We already have some of those. Thanks but no thanks.
We send to you all the delights of Anatolia: fermented murri, olive oil, wine, kefalotyri. I hope you have the good taste to appreciate them.
Antichrist! Barbarian! Heretic! The foulness of your works is the source of all suffering in the world!
Perversion and wickedness seep from your lands and stain the world! Soon the day will come where I shall cleanse your rot. (Denounces You)
You stand before Basil, Autocrat and Emperor of the Romans, scourge of my foes. Behold Rome!
We have arranged a contest at the hippodrome between the Greens and the Blues. Care to come and make a wager?
Yes.
Let me show you the glory of the new Rome, and you can tell me of wherever it is that you come from.
You may approach me.
Your decisive actions, your great victories, all are a gift of God. Make sure you thank Him.
You lack dignity, honor, piety, and all that makes a ruler righteous. Perhaps you should copy me.
Together, let us prosper with God's grace.
God's blessing upon us. Let us have peace.
God still cannot stand your wickedness! No!
The Empire is ready for peace. Are you?
I wish your soldiers God's grace on their passage through our lands.
We will not allow barbarians to set foot in the Empire. This means you, too.
Will you allow Imperial legions to march through your lands?
Armed men flying your banners mass on my borders. They must leave.
I order the legions, not you.
The legions will go elsewhere, in the name of peace.
Has God withdrawn his favor from me, that Rome must fall? Oh, what a calamity!
Your offer is unworthy of Rome.
This is a good deal for the Empire, and for you.
